content.description: Which of the following are equivalent to <math alttext="the indefinite integral from, 2 to 4, of, the fraction with numerator 2 x, plus 5, and denominator 5 minus x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?
content.question: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 2 x, plus 5, close parenthesis, d x, and denominator the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 5 minus x, close parenthesis, d x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, negative 2, plus the fraction with numerator 15, and denominator 5 minus x, end fraction, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 3, of, open parenthesis, the fraction 15 over u, end fraction, minus 2, close parenthesis, d u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
